title: Oscars 2017: Jimmy Kimmel Got Political in His Opening Monologue at the 2017 Oscars—Read the Full Transcript
text: February 26, 2017 MARK RALSTON/AFP/Getty Images Politics have been at the forefront of 2017 awards show season and the Oscars 2017 are no exception. Host Jimmy Kimmel seized on his platform to address the United States—as well as those in other countries watching the 2017 Academy Awards—as he poked fun at the POTUS and, simultaneously, called for unity. But it was his Ivanka Trump joke at the very end that probably got the attention of the fashion world the most. "This broadcast is being watched live by millions of Americans and around the world in more than 225 countries that now hate us," Kimmel said. "And I think that is an amazing thing. As you know, I don't have to tell anybody, the country is divided right now. I've been getting a lot of advice, people telling me, you need to say something to unite us, and—let's just get something straight off the top. I can't do that. There's only one brave heart in this room, and he's not going to unite us, either, okay? Mel, you look great. I think the scientology is working. I really do. I'm not the man to unite this country, but it can be done. You know... there are millions of people watching right now and if every one of you took a minute to reach out to one person you disagree with, someone you like and have a positive, considerate conversation, not as liberals or conservatives, but as Americans, if we would all do that, we would make America great again. We really could. It starts with us...
